Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.encryption.string

Class StringEncryptionPlugin<G,​S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardsquare.dexguard.encryption.string.StringEncryptionPlugin<G,​S>
  • Type Parameters:
    G - Type of the encryption key class.
    S - Type of the encrypted string data.
    public abstract class StringEncryptionPlugin<G,​S>
extends java.lang.Object
    Plugin for encrypting and decrypting strings.

    String encryption is done in two steps:

    • generation of encryption keys;
    • encryption of the string, using the encryption parameters to configure the encryption algorithm.

    The encryption key is shared amongst a group of strings. DexGuard will automatically group strings during obfuscation. The following constraints apply to extensions of this class:

    • Implementations must be stateless. They may define immutable static final constants, but must not define any other fields.
    • Implementations must not define non-static inner classes.
    • Implementations must have a no-argument constructor.
    • Instances of implementing classes must not be passed as arguments to methods.
    • The decryptString(Object, Object) method must only access fields of the following types in G and S:
      • all primitive types;
      • arrays of primitives;
      • all List, Set and Map implementations of the Java Collections Framework;
      • String, BigInteger and BigDecimal.
    • The decrypt method must not invoke other non-static methods in this class.

    The following constraints apply to encryption key classes (G and S):

    • Encryption key classes must be public.
    • They must be simple container classes that only contain fields, no methods.
    • All their fields should be public or package-visible.
    • They may contain fields of any type, as long as the decryptString(Object, Object) method only accesses fields of the allowed types (see above). E.g. the private key of a public-private key pair can be stored in a shared encryption key class. DexGuard will automatically remove fields that are only used for encryption.
    • Instances of G must only be created and modified in the createStringSharedEncryptionKey(long, Set) method.
    • Instances of G and S must not be passed as arguments to other methods. Their field values can be passed, though.

    The encryption part of this class is executed by DexGuard during obfuscation. The decryption part is integrated in and executed by the application that is processed. This additionally requires that:

    • the following methods must only use API that is available in the runtime environment of DexGuard (i.e., the Java Standard libraries from the JDK):
      • createStringSharedEncryptionKey(long, Set)
      • encryptString(Object, long, String)
    • the following method must only use API that is available in the runtime environment of the application (e.g., for Android applications, the Android SDK libraries):
      • decryptString(Object, Object)
    • the encryption key classes (G and S) must only use API that is available in both obfuscation and application environment.

    • Method Detail

      • createStringSharedEncryptionKey

        public G createStringSharedEncryptionKey​(long sharedSeed,
                                         java.util.Set<java.lang.String> strings)
        Creates a shared encryption key. The created encrypt key should be deterministic and should only be a function of the provided parameters, i.e., multiple calls to this method with the same arguments should return the same encryption key.

        See the class documentation for restrictions that apply on implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        sharedSeed - a seed for generating the shared encryption key.
        strings - all strings contained in this encryption group.
        Returns:
        properly initialized shared encryption key.

      • encryptString

        public abstract S encryptString​(G sharedEncryptionKey,
                                long stringSeed,
                                java.lang.String string)
        Returns an encrypted string data object using the given shared encryption key.

        See the class documentation for restrictions that apply on implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        sharedEncryptionKey - the shared encryption key to use for encryption.
        stringSeed - a seed that may optionally be used to generate a string-specific encryption.
        Returns:
        an encrypted representation of the given string

      • decryptString

        public abstract java.lang.String decryptString​(G sharedEncryptionKey,
                                               S encryptedString)
        Returns the decrypted string, corresponding to the given encrypted string data.

        See the class documentation for restrictions that apply on implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        sharedEncryptionKey - the shared encryption key to use for encryption.
        encryptedString - the encrypted string data.
        Returns:
        the decrypted string.
